message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.SY

This paper is about automated option discovery in reinforcement learning, which is a subfield of machine learning and artificial intelligence. The paper proposes a policy-gradient algorithm for discovering parametrized options from demonstration trajectories, which is a technique commonly used in deep learning. The paper also applies the algorithm to robot-assisted surgical videos, which falls under the category of robotics and control (cs.RO). Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.RO. Additionally, the paper uses deep networks to represent the options, which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-categories of computer vision (cs.CV) and systems and control (cs.SY).
